intro: Lessingia filaginifolia var. californica, commonly known as the California lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This variety is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and hairy, linear leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The plant is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
